revised_title: Depolarization of Light by Glass and Prince Rupert's Drops
tldr: The author, David Brewster, investigates the depolarization of light by heating and cooling glass and examines the optical properties of Prince Rupert's drops. He finds that glass can depolarize a ray of polarized light when heated and that the drops, made of white flint-glass, depolarize light in various positions, unlike crystallized substances.
